question.text: Which of these parts of the Makoi plant is incorrectly described?

options.text: Leaves: alternate, simple, exstipulate with reticulate venation
Corolla: petals five, gamopetallous with valvate aestivation
Gynoecium: bicarpellary, syncarpous with bilocular, superior ovary superior
Seeds: many seeds in a fruit, without endosperm

solution.text: Makoi plant (Solanum nigrum) or black nightshade belongs to family Solanaceae. It has alternate simple leaves without stipules but with reticulate venation. They have 5 petals with valvate aestivation which are fused to each other. Their gynoecium has two carpels that are fused together. Thus the ovary has two locules and is also superior. There are many seeds in their fruit but all of them have endosperm.
